entities.description: Continued use of methamphetamine despite causing problems with emotions, mental health, or physical health.
Needing to use methamphetamine a lot more to get the desired feeling, or using the same amount but having less of an effect.
Symptoms experienced after reducing or stopping methamphetamine use.
Classification of respondents who misuse prescription pain relievers.
Severity level of prescription pain reliever misuse classified as mild, moderate, or severe.
Specific details of symptoms when methamphetamine use is reduced, including emotional and physical specifics.
Variable indicating the recency of methamphetamine use according to the imputed recency variable.
Survey indicates if respondent injected methamphetamine with a needle in the past year.

relationships.description: Indicates the presence of withdrawal symptoms due to methamphetamine use.
Classifies the severity of pain relievers misuse as mild, moderate, or severe.
Details the specific symptoms experienced during methamphetamine withdrawal.
Evaluates the recency of methamphetamine use using the imputed recency variable.
Methamphetamine use indicated by injection in the past year.
